itemLabel: Annie Llewelyn-Davies, Baroness Llewelyn-Davies of Hastoe

wikipedia_page.main: Annie Patricia Llewelyn-Davies, Baroness Llewelyn-Davies of Hastoe,  (née Parry, formerly Rawdon Smith; 16 July 1915 – 6 November 1997) was a British Labour Party politician and life peer. In 1973 she became the first woman to take charge of a whip's office in either of the houses of the Parliament of the United Kingdom, and she served in the 1974 to 1979 Labour Government as Captain of the Gentlemen-at-Arms (Government Chief Whip).
